AD: It is a sovereign landlocked microstate in Southwestern Europe, located in the eastern Pyrenees mountains and bordered by France in the north, and the Spanish Catalonia in the south.
It is the sixth-smallest nation in Europe, having an area of 468 square kilometers and a population of approximately 77,281
Its capital is the highest capital city in Europe, at an elevation of 1,023 metres above sea level.
AE: The Country is a federal absolute monarchy in Western Asia at the southeast end of the Arabian Peninsula on the Persian Gulf, bordering Oman to the east.

The country is a federation of seven emirates, and was established on 2 December 1971. The constituent emirates are Abu Dhabi which serves as the capital, Ajman, Dubai, Fujairah, Ras al-Khaimah, Sharjah and Umm al-Quwain
Islam is the official religion, and Arabic is the official language, although English, Urdu and Hindi are widely spoken, with English being the language of business and education
AF: officially the it is an islamic state, is a landlocked country located within South Asia and Central Asia
The country has a population of 35 million, making it the 42nd most populous country in the world.
is bordered by Pakistan in the south and east; Iran in the west
AG: It is a sovereign state in the Americas, lying between the Caribbean Sea and the Atlantic Ocean.
It consists of two major islands, and a number of smaller islands, including Great Bird, Green, Guiana.
They are in the middle of the Leeward Islands, part of the Lesser Antilles, roughly at 17 Degrees north of the equator.
AI: It is a British overseas territory in the Caribbean.
It has become a popular tax haven, having no capital gains, estate, profit or other forms of direct taxation on either individuals or corporations.
It was first settled by Indigenous Amerindian peoples who migrated from South America.
AL: It is a country in Southeastern Europe. It spans 28,748 square kilometres and had a total population of 3 million people as of 2016
It is in the southwestern portion of the Balkan Peninsula, bordered by Montenegro to the northwest, Kosovo to the northeast
Much of the country is mountainous, including the Korab Mountains in the east, the Ceraunian Mountains in the south and the Skanderbeg Mountains in the center.
AM: The country is bordered by Turkey to the west, Georgia to the north.
It is a unitary, multi-party, democratic nation state with an ancient cultural heritage.
Between the 16th century and 19th century, it came under the rule of the Ottoman and Iranian empires.
AO: It is a country in Southern Africa. It is the seventh-largest country in Africa, bordered by Namibia to the south, the Democratic Republic of the Congo to the north.
Although inhabited since the Paleolithic Era, its culture was molded by Portuguese colonisation
The civil war between the ruling MPLA and the insurgent anti-communist UNITA, supported by the United States and apartheid South Africa, lasted until 2002.
AQ: It is a polar region, specifically the region around the Earths South Pole.
The maritime part of the region constitutes the area of application of the international CCAMLR.
A variety of animals live there, including, Seals, Penguins, Whales, Albatrosses and Squid.
AR: It is a federal republic in the southern portion of South America. Sharing the bulk of the Southern Cone with its neighbor Chile to the west.
The earliest recorded human presence in the area dates back to the Paleolithic period. The country has its roots in Spanish colonization of the region during the 16th century.
After 1930, It descended into political instability and periodic economic crises that pushed it back into underdevelopment.
AS: It consists of five main islands and two coral atolls. The largest and most populous island is Tutuila, with the Manuʻa Islands, Rose Atoll, and Swains Island also included in the territory.
The 2010 census showed a total population of 55,519 people. The total land area is 199 square kilometers
During the 1918 flu pandemic, Governor John Martin Poyer quarantined the territory, and because of his actions, it was one of the few places in the world where no flu-related deaths occurred.
AT: The country is a federal republic and a landlocked country of over 8.7 million people in Central Europe.
It is bordered by the Czech Republic and Germany to the north, Hungary and Slovakia to the east.
It is bordered by  Slovenia and Italy to the south, and Switzerland and Liechtenstein to the west.
AU: It is a sovereign country comprising the mainland, the island of Tasmania and numerous smaller islands.
For about 50,000 years before the first British settlement in the late 18th century, it was inhabited by indigenous people.
It has the worlds 13th-largest economy and tenth-highest per capita income.
AW: It is an island and a constituent country of the Kingdom of the Netherlands in the southern Caribbean Sea.
It is located about 1,600 kilometres west of the main part of the Lesser Antilles and 29 kilometres north of the coast of Venezuela
It is one of the four countries that form the Kingdom of the Netherlands, along with the Netherlands, Curaçao, and Sint Maarten.
AX: Tt is an archipelago at the entrance to the Gulf of Bothnia in the Baltic Sea belonging to Finland
The autonomous status of the islands was affirmed by a decision made by the League of Nations in 1921 following a dispute
The country remains exclusively Swedish speaking
AZ: It is a country in the South Caucasus region of Eurasia at the crossroads of Eastern Europe and Western Asia.
The Democratic Republic proclaimed its independence in 1918 and became the first democratic state in the Muslim-oriented world
The country is a member state of the Council of Europe, the OSCE and the NATO Partnership for Peace program.
BA: It is a region that traces permanent human settlement back to the Neolithic age, during and after which it was populated by several Illyrian and Celtic civilizations.
Culturally, politically, and socially, the country has a rich history, having been first settled by the Slavic peoples that populate the area today from the 6th through to the 9th centuries.
It was part of the Kingdom of Yugoslavia and after World War II, it was granted full republic status in the newly formed Socialist Federal Republic of Yugoslavia.
BB: It is an island country in the Lesser Antilles, in the Caribbean region of North America.
Inhabited by Kalinago people since the 13th century, and prior to that by other Amerindians, The island was visited by Spanish navigators in the late 15th century and claimed for the Spanish Crown.
The Portuguese visited the island in 1536, but they left it unclaimed, with their only remnants being an introduction of wild hogs for a good supply of meat whenever the island was visited.
BD: It is a country in South Asia. It shares land borders with India and Myanmar.
Nepal, Bhutan and China are located nearby but do not share a border with it.
Dhaka is its capital and largest city, followed by Chittagong, which has the countrys largest port.
BE: It is a sovereign state in Western Europe bordered by France, the Netherlands, Germany, Luxembourg, and the North Sea.

It is home to two main linguistic groups: the Dutch-speaking, mostly Flemish community, which constitutes about 59 percent of the population, and the French-speaking, mostly Walloon population, which comprises about 40 percent.
It is one of the Benelux group of countries.
BF: It is a landlocked country in West Africa. It covers an area of around 274,200 square kilometres.
It is surrounded by six countries: Mali to the north, Niger to the east, Benin to the southeast, Togo and Ghana to the south, and Ivory Coast to the southwest.
Its capital is Ouagadougou. In 2014 its population was estimated at just over 17.3 million.
BG: It is a country in southeastern Europe. It is bordered by Romania to the north, Serbia and Macedonia to the west, Greece and Turkey to the south, and the Black Sea to the east.

Organised prehistoric cultures began developing on the current lands during the Neolithic period. Its ancient history saw the presence of the Thracians, Greeks, Persians, Celts, Romans, Goths, Alans and Huns.
The emergence of a unified state dates back to the establishment of the First Empire in the this countries name in 681 AD.
BH: It is an Arab constitutional monarchy in the Persian Gulf. It is an island country consisting of a small archipelago centered around its main Island.
It is situated between the Qatar peninsula and the north eastern coast of Saudi Arabia, to which it is connected by the 25 km long King Fahd Causeway.
The country is the site of the ancient Dilmun civilisation. and has been famed since antiquity for its pearl fisheries.
BI: It is a landlocked country in the African Great Lakes region of East Africa.
It bordered by Rwanda to the north, Tanzania to the east and south, and the Democratic Republic of the Congo to the west. It is also considered part of Central Africa.

The Twa, Hutu and Tutsi peoples have lived in the country for at least 500 years. For more than 200 of those years, it was an independent kingdom, until the beginning of the 20th century, when Germany colonised the region.
BJ: It is a country in West Africa. It is bordered by Togo to the west, Nigeria to the east, and Burkina Faso and Niger to the north.
The majority of its population lives on the small southern coastline, part of the Gulf of Guinea in the northernmost tropical portion of the Atlantic Ocean
The capital city is Porto-Novo, but the seat of government is in Cotonou.
BL: Called Ouanalao by the indigenous people, it is an overseas collectivity of France in the West Indies
It was for many years a French commune forming part of Guadeloupe, which is an overseas region and department of France.
It is a volcanic island fully encircled by shallow reefs, has an area of 25 square kilometres and a population of 9,278 according to a 2013 census.
BM: the countries economy is based on offshore insurance and reinsurance, and tourism.

It has a subtropical climate. The island is in the hurricane belt and prone to related severe weather, however, it is somewhat protected by a coral reef that surrounds the island and its position at the north of the belt.
The country is famous for a triangle where things seem to dissapear.
BN: It is a sovereign state located on the north coast of the island of Borneo in Southeast Asia. Apart from its coastline with the South China Sea, the country is completely surrounded by the Malaysian state of Sarawak
It is the only sovereign state completely on the island of Borneo; the remainder of the islands territory is divided between the nations of Malaysia and Indonesia.
The country gained its independence from the United Kingdom on 1 January 1984.
BO: It is located in western-central South America. It is bordered to the north and east by Brazil, to the southeast by Paraguay
It is bordered to the south by Argentina, to the southwest by Chile, and to the northwest by Peru. It has no ocean access. One-third of the country is within the Andean mountain range.
Before Spanish colonization, the Andean region of the country formed part of the Incan Empire.
BQ: It is sometimes used to refer to all of the islands in the Dutch Caribbean. In legislation, the three islands are also known as the BES islands
The three islands gained their current status following the dissolution of the Netherlands Antilles on 10 October 2010.
The coutries residents first voted in Dutch general elections in 2012.
BR: It is the largest country in both South America and Latin America
The countries most-populated city is São Paulo.
It was inhabited by numerous tribal nations prior to the landing in 1500 of explorer Pedro Álvares Cabral, who claimed the area for the Portuguese Empire.
BS: It consists of more than 700 islands, cays, and islets in the Atlantic Ocean, and is located north of Cuba and Hispaniola.
It is located southeast of the United States specifically the state of Florida,
It became an independent Commonwealth realm in 1973, retaining the British monarch, then and currently Queen Elizabeth II, as its head of state.
BT: It is a landlocked country in South Asia. Located in the Eastern Himalayas, it is bordered by Tibet.
It is bordered by the Sikkim state of India and the Chumbi Valley of Tibet in the west, the Arunachal Pradesh state of India in the east and the Assam state of India in the south.

The independence of of the country has endured for centuries, and the territory was never colonized in its history. Situated on the ancient Silk Road between Tibet, the Indian subcontinent and Southeast Asia.
BV: It is an uninhabited subantarctic high island and dependency of Norway located in the South Atlantic Ocean.
The island has an area of 49 square kilometres, of which 93 percent is covered by a glacier.
The island was first spotted on 1 January 1739 by Frenchman Jean-Baptiste Charles Bouvet de Lozier, after whom it was later named.
BW: It is a landlocked country located in Southern Africa. it was formerly the British protectorate of Bechuanalandn.
Up to 70 percent of its territory is the Kalahari Desert. It is bordered by South Africa to the south and southeast, Namibia to the west and north, and Zimbabwe to the northeast
It is one of the most sparsely populated countries in the world. Around 10 percent of the population lives in the capital and largest city, Gaborone.
BY: It is a landlocked country in Eastern Europe, bordered by Russia to the northeast, Ukraine to the south, Poland to the west, and Lithuania and Latvia to the northwest.
Its capital and most populous city is Minsk
In the aftermath of the 1917 Russian Revolution, it declared independence as a Peoples Republic, which then was conquered by Soviet Russia.
BZ: It was formerly British Honduras, and is an independent Commonwealth realm on the eastern coast of Central America
It is considered a Central American and Caribbean nation with strong ties to both the Latin American and Caribbean regions.
The country is known for its September Celebrations, its extensive barrier reef coral reefs, and punta music.
CA: It is a country located in the northern part of North America. Its ten provinces and three territories extend from the Atlantic to the Pacific and northward into the Arctic Ocean.
Its Southern border with the United States is the worlds longest bi-national land border.
Britain still maintained control of the countries foreign affairs under the Confederation Act, and Britains declaration of war in 1914 automatically brought this country into World War I.
CC: It is an Australian external territory in the Indian Ocean, comprising a small archipelago approximately midway between Australia and Sri Lanka.
The territory consists of two atolls made up of 27 coral islands, of which only two, West Island, and Home Island are inhabited.
The population of around 600 people consists mainly of Malays, who practise Sunni Islam and speak a dialect of Malay as their first language.
CD: It borders the Central African Republic and South Sudan to the north; Uganda, Rwanda, Burundi and Tanzania to the east; Zambia to the south; Angola to the southwest; and the Republic of the Congo and the Atlantic Ocean to the west.
It is the second-largest country in Africa by area, and 11th largest in the world. With a population of over 78 million.
European exploration of the country was carried out, and first led by Henry Morton Stanley under the sponsorship of King Leopold II of Belgium.
CF: It is bordered by Chad to the north, Sudan to the northeast, South Sudan to the east, the Democratic Republic of the Congo to the south, the Republic of the Congo to the southwest and Cameroon to the west.
What is today the country has been inhabited for millennia; however, the countrys current borders were established by France, which ruled the country as a colony starting in the late 19th century.

Despite its significant mineral deposits and other resources, such as uranium reserves, crude oil, gold, diamonds, cobalt, lumber, and hydropower, as well as significant quantities of arable land, the Country is among the ten poorest countries in the world
CG: is a country in Central Africa. It is bordered by five countries, Gabon and the Atlantic Ocean to the west, Cameroon to the northwest, the Central African Republic to the northeast, the Democratic Republic of the Congo to the east and south.
The political stability and development of hydrocarbon production made the country the fourth largest oil producer in the Gulf of Guinea, providing the country with a degree of prosperity.
Multi-party elections have been held since 1992, although a democratically elected government was ousted in the countries 1997 Civil War
CH: It is officially a Confederation, and is a federal republic in Europe. It consists of 26 cantons, and the city of Bern is the seat of the federal authorities
It is bordered by Italy to the south, France to the west, Germany to the north, and Austria and Liechtenstein to the east.
It is one of the most developed countries in the world, with the highest nominal wealth per adult and the eighth-highest per capita gross domestic product according to the IMF
CI: It is a sovereign state located in West Africa. its political capital is Yamoussoukro.

Through the production of coffee and cocoa, the country was an economic powerhouse in West Africa during the 1960s and 1970s, however went through an economic crisis in the 1980s, contributing to a period of political and social turmoil.
The official language is French, with local indigenous languages also widely used, including Baoulé, Dioula, Dan, Anyin, and Cebaara Senufo
CK: It is a self-governing island country in the South Pacific Ocean in free association with New Zealand.
New Zealand is responsible for this countries defence and foreign affairs, but they are exercised in consultation with this country.
The main population centre is the island of Rarotonga, where there is an international airport.
CL: It is a South American country occupying a long, narrow strip of land between the Andes to the east and the Pacific Ocean to the west.
It is today one of South Americas most stable and prosperous nations, with a high-income economy and high living standards.
A military coup led by General Luis Altamirano in 1924 set off a period of political instability that lasted until 1932.
CM: It is a South American country occupying a long, narrow strip of land between the Andes to the east and the Pacific Ocean to the west.
It is today one of South Americas most stable and prosperous nations, with a high-income economy and high living standards.
33 miners were rescued who were trapped inside the San Jose mine near Copiapo, on August 6, 2010. which raised the profile of this country internationally
CN: It is a unitary sovereign state in East Asia and the worlds most populous country, with a population of around 1.404 billion.

The country emerged as one of the worlds earliest civilizations, in the fertile basin of the Yellow River in the North Plain in this country. For millennia, its political system was based on hereditary monarchies, or dynasties
Since the introduction of economic reforms in 1978, its economy has been one of the worlds fastest-growing.
CO: It is a sovereign state largely situated in the northwest of South America, with territories in Central America. it shares a border to the northwest with Panama, to the east with Venezuela and Brazil, and to the south with Ecuador and Peru.
Its territory also encompasses Amazon rainforest, tropical grassland and both Caribbean and Pacific coastlines
The Country entered the Korean War when Laureano Gómez was elected president. It was the only Latin American country to join the war in a direct military role as an ally of the United States.
CR: It is a country in Central America, bordered by Nicaragua to the north, Panama to the southeast, the Pacific Ocean to the west, the Caribbean Sea to the east.

It was sparsely inhabited by indigenous people before coming under Spanish rule in the 16th century. It remained a peripheral colony of the empire until independence as part of the short-lived First Mexican Empire
This country stands as the most visited nation in the Central American region. and tourists from the United States are it largest patrons with over 1 million visitors to this country
CU: It is located in the northern Caribbean where the Caribbean Sea, the Gulf of Mexico, and the Atlantic Ocean meet. It is south of both the U.S. state of Florida and the Bahamas.
Havana is the largest city and capital, and is the largest island in the Caribbean
This country was run by a single dictator for many years who was famously the subject of a plot by the CIA in 1960 to assasinate him with an exploding cigar.
CV: It is an island country spanning an archipelago of 10 volcanic islands in the central Atlantic Ocean.

Since the early 1990s, it has been a stable representative democracy, and remains one of the most developed and democratic countries in Africa. Lacking natural resources, its developing economy is mostly service-oriented
Its Prime Minister José Maria Neves met with the US Secretary of Defense Chuck Hagel, in 2013.
CX: It is an Australian external territory comprising of this island.
It has a population of 1,843 residents as of 2016, the majority of whom live in settlements on the northern tip of the island. The main settlement is Flying Fish Cove.
The first European to sight the island was Richard Rowe of the Thomas in 1615. The island was later named on Christmas Day 1643 by Captain William Mynors, but only settled in the late 19th century
CY: It is an island country in the Eastern Mediterranean and the third largest and third most populous island in the Mediterranean.

The earliest known human activity on the island dates to around the 10th millennium BC. Archaeological remains from this period include the well-preserved Neolithic village of Khirokitia, and it is home to some of the oldest water wells in the world.
It was placed under British administration based on a Convention in 1878 and was formally annexed by Britain in 1914.
CZ: It is a landlocked nation state in Central Europe bordered by Germany to the west, Austria to the south, Slovakia to the east and Poland to the northeast.
The most stable and prosperous of the post-Communist states, it saw growth of over 6 percent annually in the three years before the outbreak of the recent global economic crisis.
DE: It is a federal parliamentary republic in central-western Europe. It includes 16 constituent states.
Prior to World War II the first Nazi concentration camp at Dachau opened in this country.
It capital city was split into two after World War II and seperated by a wall which was torn down in 1989
DJ: It is a country located in the Horn of Africa. It is bordered by Eritrea in the north, Ethiopia in the west and south, and Somalia in the southeast.
It located near some of the worlds busiest shipping lanes, controlling access to the Red Sea and Indian Ocean, and is the principal maritime port for imports from and exports to neighboring Ethiopia.
The President, currently Ismaïl Omar Guelleh, is the prominent figure in its politics; the head of state and commander-in-chief of its armed forces.
DK: It is a Nordic country and a sovereign state. The southernmost of the Scandinavian nations, it is south-west of Sweden and south of Norway.
This country, Sweden and Norway were ruled together under the Kalmar Union, established in 1397 and ending with Swedish secession in 1523.
It is considered to be one of the happiest countries in the world. the population enjoy a high standard of living, and the country ranks highly in some metrics of national performance.
DM: The capital, Roseau, is located on the leeward side of the island. It is part of the Windward Islands in the Lesser Antilles archipelago in the Caribbean Sea.
The island was originally inhabited by the Kalinago and later colonised by Europeans, predominantly by the French from the 1690s to 1763.
Columbus is said to have passed the island on Sunday, 3 November 1493, and the islands name is derived from the Latin for Sunday.
DO: It is a sovereign state located in the island of Hispaniola, in the Greater Antilles archipelago of the Caribbean region.

It occupies the eastern five-eighths of the island, which it shares with the nation of Haiti, making Hispaniola one of two Caribbean islands, along with Saint Martin, that are shared by two countries.
Christopher Columbus landed on the island on December 5, 1492, which the native Taíno people had inhabited since the 7th century.
DZ: It is a sovereign state in North Africa on the Mediterranean coast.
It is the tenth largest country in the world, and the largest in Africa since South Sudan became independent from Sudan in 2011.
The North African country supplies large amounts of natural gas to Europe, and energy exports are the backbone of the economy.
EC: It is a representative democratic republic in northwestern South America, bordered by Colombia on the north, Peru on the east and south, and the Pacific Ocean to the west.
The country also includes the Galápagos Islands in the Pacific, about 1000 kilometres west of the mainland.
The capital city is Quito, while the largest city is Guayaquil.
EE: It is a country in the Baltic region of Northern Europe. It is bordered to the north by the Gulf of Finland, to the west by the Baltic Sea, to the south by Latvia, and to the east by Russia.
The territory has been inhabited since at least 6500 BC, with Finno-Ugric speakers, who are the linguistic ancestors of the current population,arriving no later than around 1800 BC
The Country experienced a national awakening that culminated in independence from the Russian Empire towards the end of World War one on 24 February 1918.
EG: Spanning the northeast corner of Africa and southwest corner of Asia by a land bridge formed by the Sinai Peninsula.
It is a Mediterranean country bordered by the Gaza Strip and Israel to the northeast, the Gulf of Aqaba to the east, the Red Sea to the east and south, Sudan to the south, and Libya to the west.
It emerged as one of the worlds first nation states in the tenth millennium BC. and is Considered a cradle of civilisation.
EH: It calls the territories under its control the Liberated Territories or the Free Zone. Morocco controls and administers the rest of the disputed territory and calls these lands its Southern Provinces.
The republic maintains diplomatic relations with 40 UN states, and is a full member of the African Union.
The Presendential post held by the secretary-general of the Polisario, is presently Brahim Ghali.
ER: It is a country in the Horn of Africa, with its capital at Asmara. It is bordered by Sudan in the west, Ethiopia in the south, and Djibouti in the southeast.
The northeastern and eastern parts of this country have an extensive coastline along the Red Sea.
The Kingdom of Aksum, covering much of this modern-day Country and Northern Ethiopia, was established during the first or second centuries AD.
ES: It is a country mostly located on the Iberian Peninsula in Europe, with there also being two large archipelagoes, the Balearic Islands in the Mediterranean Sea and the Canary Islands off the African Atlantic coast.
It is the largest country in Southern Europe, the second largest country in Western Europe and the European Union, and the fourth largest country in the European continent, by population.
This country lays claim to Gibraltar which is currently a British Overseas Territory, and as such there is political tension between Britian and this country.
ET: It is a country located in the Horn of Africa. It shares borders with Eritrea to the north and northeast, Djibouti and Somalia to the east, Sudan and South Sudan to the west, and Kenya to the south.

Some of the oldest skeletal evidence for anatomically modern humans has been found in this country, It is widely considered as the region from which modern humans first set out for the Middle East and places beyond.
This country is the place of origin of the coffee bean, which was first cultivated at Kefa, one of the 14 provinces in this countries old administration.
FI: It is sovereign state in Northern Europe. The country has land borders with Sweden to the northwest, Norway to the north, and Russia to the east.

this country was inhabited when the last ice age ended, approximately 9000 BC. The first settlers left behind artifacts that present characteristics which are shared with those found in Estonia, Russia, and Norway.

Following the 1917 Russian Revolution, this country declared itself independent. In 1918, the fledgling state was divided by civil war, with the Bolshevik-leaning Red Guard supported by the equally new Soviet Russia, fighting the White Guard, supported by the German Empire.
FJ: It is an island country in Melanesia in the South Pacific Ocean about 1100 nautical miles northeast of New Zealandss North Island.
this country has one of the most developed economies in the Pacific due to an abundance of forest, mineral, and fish resources.
Its Main island is known as Viti Levu and it is from this that this countrys name is derived, though the common English pronunciation is based on that of their island neighbours in Tonga.
FK: It is an archipelago in the South Atlantic Ocean on the Patagonian Shelf. The principal islands are about 300 miles east of South Americas southern Patagonian coast
The Spanish name for the archipelago is Islas Malvinas, and it is by this name that Argentina lay claim to the archipelago
Britain and Argentina went to war on the 2nd April 1982 over this archipelago, and the war lasted for 10 weeks.
FM: It is an independent sovereign island nation and a United States associated state consisting of four states, from west to east, Yap, Chuuk, Pohnpei and Kosrae. That are spread across the Western Pacific Ocean.
While this countrys total land area is quite small, it occupies more than one million square miles of the Pacific Ocean
The ancestors of the people settled over four thousand years ago. A decentralized chieftain-based system eventually evolved into a more centralized economic and religious culture centered on Yap.
FO: It is an archipelago between the Norwegian Sea and the North Atlantic, about halfway between Norway and Iceland.

Between 1035 and 1814, the country was part of the Hereditary Kingdom of Norway. In 1814, the Treaty of Kiel granted Denmark control over the islands, along with two other Norwegian island possessions, Greenland and Iceland
Archaeological evidence shows settlers living on the Islands in two successive periods prior to the arrival of Vikings, the first between 300 and 600 AD, and the second between 600 and 800 AD.
FR: It is a country whose territory consists of the mainland in western Europe, as well as several overseas regions and territories.
During the Iron Age,the country was inhabited by the Gauls, a Celtic people. Rome annexed the area in 51 BC, and held the region until 486, when the Germanic Franks conquered the region
The country has long been a global centre of art, science, and philosophy. It hosts Europes third-largest number of cultural UNESCO World Heritage Sites.
GA: It is a sovereign state on the west coast of Central Africa. Located on the equator, it is bordered by Equatorial Guinea to the northwest, Cameroon to the north, the Republic of the Congo on the east and south, and the Gulf of Guinea to the west.
Since its independence from France in 1960, the country has had three presidents preside over it
The earliest inhabitants of the area were Pygmy peoples. They were largely replaced and absorbed by Bantu tribes as they migrated.
GB-ENG: It is a country that is part of the United Kingdom.
It was first inhabited by modern humans during the Upper Palaeolithic period, but takes its name from the Angles, a Germanic tribe deriving its name from the Anglia peninsula
Prominent figures born in this country from the field of science and mathematics include Sir Isaac Newton, Michael Faraday, Charles Darwin.
GB-SCT: It is a country that is part of the United Kingdom and covers the northern third of the island of Great Britain.
Its national flower is the Thistle
The countries traditional dress includes the Kilt.
GB-WLS: It is a country that is part of the United Kingdom and the island of Great Britain. It is bordered by England to the east, the Irish Sea to the north and west.
A town in the country called Llanfair­pwllgwyngyll­gogery­chwyrn­drobwll­llan­tysilio­gogo­goch is the second longest in the world with 58 characters.
GD: It is located northwest of Trinidad and Tobago, northeast of Venezuela and southwest of Saint Vincent and the Grenadines.
Before the arrival of Europeans to the Americas, It was inhabited by the indigenous Arawaks and later by the Island Caribs.
Christopher Columbus sighted this country in 1498 during his third voyage to the Americas.
GE: It is a country in the Caucasus region of Eurasia. Located at the crossroads of Western Asia and Eastern Europe.
It is bounded to the west by the Black Sea, to the north by Russia, to the south by Turkey and Armenia, and to the southeast by Azerbaijan.

The Couuntry adopted Christianity in the early 4th century. its unified Kingdom reached the peak of its political and economic strength during the reign of King David IV and Queen Tamar in the 12th and early 13th centuries.
GG: It is an island in the English Channel off the coast of Normandy. It lies roughly north of St Malo and to the west of the Cotentin Peninsula.
The entire jurisdiction lies within the Common Travel Area of the British Isles and is not a member of the European Union, but has a special relationship with it.
Around 6000 BC, rising seas created the English Channel and separated the Norman promontories that became the bailiwicks of this country and Jersey from continental Europe.
GH: It is a unitary presidential constitutional democracy, located along the Gulf of Guinea and Atlantic Ocean, in the subregion of West Africa.
Numerous kingdoms and empires emerged over the centuries in this countrys lands, of which the most powerful was the Kingdom of Ashanti.

Winning the year 2000 elections, John Agyekum Kufuor of the New Patriotic Party was sworn into office as its president on 7th January 2001, and attained the presidency again in the elections four years later.
GI: It is a British Overseas Territory located at the southern tip of the Iberian Peninsula.
An Anglo-Dutch force captured this country from Spain in 1704 during the War of the Spanish Succession.
The sovereignty of this country is a major point of contention in Anglo-Spanish relations as Spain asserts a claim to the territory.
GL: It is an autonomous constituent country within the Kingdom of Denmark between the Arctic and Atlantic Oceans.
It is the worlds largest island. Australia and Antarctica, although larger, are generally considered to be continental landmasses rather than islands.
It has been inhabited off and on for at least the last 4500 years by Arctic peoples whose forebears migrated there from what is now Canada.
GM: The Country is situated on either side of the its main River which is the nations namesake, which flows through its centre of and empties into the Atlantic Ocean.

Adama Barrow became The countrys third president in January 2017, after defeating Jammeh in the 2016 elections. Jammeh initially accepted the results, then refused to accept them, which triggered a constitutional crisis.
The countrys economy is dominated by farming, fishing and, especially, tourism. In 2008, about a third of the population lived below the international poverty line of 1.25 US Dollars per day.
GN: It is a country on the western coast of Africa, and is a predominantly Islamic country, with Muslims representing 85 percent of the population.
It is the worlds second largest producer of bauxite, and has rich deposits of diamonds and gold.
The country was at the core of the 2014 Ebola outbreak.
GP: It is an insular region of France located in the Leeward Islands, part of the Lesser Antilles in the Caribbean.
The two main islands are Basse-Terre to the west and Grande-Terre to the east, which are separated by a narrow strait that is crossed with bridges, they are often referred to as a single island.

It is an integral part of France, and as a constituent territory of the European Union and the Eurozone, the euro is its official currency and any European Union citizen is free to settle and work there indefinitely.
GQ: It consists of two parts, an insular and a mainland region. The insular region consists of the islands of Bioko, and Annobón, a small volcanic island which is the only part of the country south of the equator.
Since the mid-1990s, it has become one of sub-Saharan Africas largest oil producers. It is the richest country per capita in Africa.
The countrys authoritarian government has one of the worst human rights records in the world.
GR: It historically also known as Hellas, and is a country in Southern Europe, with a population of approximately 11 million as of 2016.
Athens is the nations capital and largest city, followed by Thessaloniki.
It is considered the cradle of Western civilization, being the birthplace of democracy, Western philosophy, and the Olympic Games amongst other things
GT: It is a country in Central America bordered by Mexico to the north and west, the Pacific Ocean to the southwest, Belize to the northeast, the Caribbean to the east, Honduras to the east and El Salvador to the southeast.

From the mid to late 19th century, it experienced chronic instability and civil strife. Beginning in the early 20th century, it was ruled by a series of dictators backed by the United Fruit Company and the United States government.
After they arrived in the New World, the Spanish started several expeditions tothis country, beginning in 1519.
GU: It is a regional organization of four post-Soviet states: Georgia, Ukraine, Azerbaijan, and Moldova.
It was established on 10 October 1997, in Strasbourg, and named after the initial letters of each of its constituent countries.
Altai Efendiev is its current Secretary General.
GY: It is a sovereign state on the northern mainland of South America. It is, however, often considered part of the Caribbean region because of its strong cultural, historical, and political ties with other Anglo Caribbean countries.
The region consists of the large shield landmass north of the Amazon River and east of the Orinoco River known as the land of many waters
It is the only South American nation in which English is the official language.
HK: It is an autonomous territory on the eastern side of the Pearl River estuary in East Asia, south of the mainland Chinese province of Guangdong, and east of the special administrative region of Macau.
It was formerly a colony of the British Empire, after the perpetual cession of the Island from Qing China at the conclusion of the First Opium War in 1842
The colony expanded to the Kowloon Peninsula in 1860 after the Second Opium War, and was further extended when Britain acquired a 99-year lease of the New Territories starting in 1898.
HN: It is bordered to the west by Guatemala, to the southwest by El Salvador, to the southeast by Nicaragua, to the south by the Pacific Ocean at the Gulf of Fonseca, and to the north by the Gulf of its Namesake.
The nations economy is primarily agricultural making it especially vulnerable to natural disasters such as Hurricane Mitch in 1998.
The nation had a relatively high political stability until its 2009 coup, and again with the 2017 presidential elections, it has the worlds highest murder rate and high levels of sexual violence
HR: It is a country situated at the crossroads of Central and Southeast Europe, on the Adriatic Sea. Its capital city is Zagreb, which forms one of the countrys primary subdivisions.
It was a constituent region of former country of Yugoslavia up until the commencement of the 1991 yugoslav wars.
The nation declared independence on 25 June 1991, however, the full implementation of declaration only came into effect on 8th October 1991.
HU: It is bordered by Slovakia to the north, Romania to the east, Serbia to the south, Croatia to the southwest, Slovenia to the west, Austria to the northwest, and Ukraine to the northeast.
The foundation of this country was laid in the late 9th century by its grand prince Árpád in the conquest of the Carpathian Basin.
its current borders were established in 1920 by the Treaty of Trianon after World War I, when the country lost 71 percent of its territory.
ID: It is a unitary sovereign state and transcontinental country located mainly in Southeast Asia, with some territories in Oceania. Situated between the Indian and Pacific oceans.
It is the worlds 14th largest country in terms of land area and the 7th largest in terms of combined sea and land area. With over 261 million people, it is the worlds 4th most populous country.

its large and growing population, and rapid industrialisation, present serious environmental issues. They are often given a lower priority due to high poverty levels and weak, under-resourced governance.
ZW: It is a landlocked country located in southern Africa, between the Zambezi and Limpopo Rivers.
It is bordered by South Africa, Botswana, Zambia and Mozambique.
The capital and largest city is Harare. It is a country of roughly 16 million people.
ZM: It is bordered the Democratic Republic of the Congo to the north, Tanzania to the north-east, Malawi to the east, Mozambique, Zimbabwe, Botswana and Namibia to the south, and Angola to the west.
The capital city is Lusaka, in the south-central part of the country.
On 24 October 1964, It became independent of the United Kingdom and prime minister Kenneth Kaunda became the inaugural president.
ZA: It is the southernmost country in Africa.
ItS first black president was Nelson Mandela.
It is a multiethnic society encompassing a wide variety of cultures, languages, and religions.
YT: It is a group of islands, and a region of France.
It consists of a main island, Grande-Terre , a smaller island, Petite-Terre, and several islets around these two.
It is is surrounded by a typical tropical coral reef. It consists in a large outer barrier reef, enclosing one of the worlds largest and deepest lagoons,
YE: It  is an Arab country in Western Asia
It is bordered by Saudi Arabia to the north, the Red Sea to the west, the Gulf of Aden and Arabian Sea to the south, and Oman to the east-northeast.
It is a developing country, and the poorest country in the Middle East.
WS: It has two main islands, Savaii and Upolu with four smaller islands surrounding the landmasses.
The entire island group was called Navigator Islands by European explorers before the 20th century because of the countrys seafaring skills.
XK: It is landlocked in the central Balkan Peninsula.
It  declared independence from Serbia in February 2008.
Its capital and largest city is Pristina.
WF: It is a French island collectivity in the South Pacific between Tuvalu to the northwest, Fiji to the southwest, Tonga to the southeast, Samoa to the east, and Tokelau to the northeast.
Mata-Utu is the capital and biggest city.
The territory is made up of three main volcanic tropical islands along with a number of tiny islets, and is split into two island groups that lie about 260 km apart,
VU: It is a Pacific island nation located in the South Pacific Ocean.
It is a Y-shaped archipelago consisting of about 82 relatively small, geologically newer islands of volcanic origin
It was first inhabited by Melanesian people. The first Europeans to visit the islands were a Spanish expedition led by Portuguese navigator Fernandes de Queirós.
VN: It is the easternmost country on the Indochina Peninsula in Southeast Asia.
Conflict between the North and South of the country led to a war from 1966 - 1975.
Its capital city has been Hanoi since the reunification of North and South of the country in 1976
VI: It  is a group of islands in the Caribbean.
It consists of the main islands of Saint Croix, Saint John, and Saint Thomas, and many other surrounding minor islands.
The territorys capital is Charlotte Amalie on the island of Saint Thomas.
VG: They are a British Overseas Territory in the Caribbean, to the east of Puerto Rico.
Parts of the islands were damaged in September 2017 by Hurricane Irma and an estimated ten people were killed by the storm.
The capital, Road Town, is on Tortola, the largest island.
VE: It is a federal republic located on the northern coast of South America.
It is bordered by Colombia on the west, Brazil on the south, Guyana on the east, the Dutch Caribbean ABC islands to the north and the islands of Trinidad and Tobago to the north-east.
VC: Kingstown is the capital and main port.
It consists of a main island and the northern two thirds of a chain of smaller islands stretching south.
It lies to the west of Barbados, south of Saint Lucia and north of Grenada in the Windward Islands of the Lesser Antilles, an island arc of the Caribbean Sea.
VA: it is officially the worlds smallest country.
This country is where the Pope resides
It is the only country that resides within the boundaries of a city which is not part of the country.
UZ: It is one of the largest Central Asian states.
It is one of two doubly landlocked countries in the world that is, a country completely surrounded by landlocked countries.
It declared independence from the Soviet Union in 1991, an election was held, and Islam Karimov was elected as the first President of this country.
UY: It is a sovereign state in the southeastern region of South America.
Its capital and largest city is Montevideo
It is geographically the second-smallest nation in South America.
US: It is a federal republic composed of 50 states,
New York is the largest city.
UG: It is a landlocked country in East Africa.
The southern part of the country includes a substantial portion of Lake Victoria, shared with Kenya and Tanzania.
UA: It is a sovereign state in Eastern Europe.
It is bordered by Russia, Belaru, Poland, Hungary, Slovakia, Romania and Moldova and the Black Sea and Sea of Azov.
The capital and largest city is Kiev.
